page.title: 03Pennland Puppy Centre
page.content: For ten years known as Sunderland Puppy Centre;now as the above.About 40 puppies are looked after by the owner and two staff who all live nearby.A few puppies are bred here but most are bought in and if they seem dirty then they are given a bath.Thet are fed three times a day on mince and biscuits.The most popular puppy is the Jack Russell terrier;the youngest puppy is a 6 week old German Shepherd. 9 guard dogs - German Shepherds and Dobermans - are kept for a security firm in the town.Most are trained at a large yard at the centre but Tara was trained by an ex police dog handler at Easington Village.The dogs eat mince or tripe(it smells) and biscuits once a day.Toya the oldest is 6years;Abbey the youngest is 10 months.Kim is the fiercest guard dog.
